sub_features.name: AI Trace View
sub_features.notes: Span-level LLM tracing capturing prompts, responses, parameters, latency, and errors for models including OpenAI, Anthropic, and Bedrock.

sub_features.name: Hierarchical trace visualization
sub_features.notes: Tree and step-by-step debugging views displaying parent-child spans for LLM chains and agents.

sub_features.name: OpenInference Tracing
sub_features.notes: OTEL-based tracing supports streaming in background, but the UI may lag for real-time live streaming.

sub_features.name: Python Auto-instrumentation
sub_features.notes: One-line decorators and autolog for 50+ integrations, including LangChain, LlamaIndex, and DSPy.

sub_features.name: Claude Agent SDK Instrumentation
sub_features.notes: OpenInference instrumentation via @arizeai/openinference-instrumentation-claude-agent-sdk automatically capturing AGENT and TOOL spans for Claude Agent SDK applications.

sub_features.name: Interactive trace querying
sub_features.notes: Supports custom metadata and tag attachment with interactive search and filtering in the UI.

sub_features.name: Token usage analytics
sub_features.notes: Provides accurate tracking of per-token input and output values.

sub_features.name: OpenTelemetry-native setup
sub_features.notes: Core architecture natively uses the OTLP protocol for vendor-agnostic trace export and import.

sub_features.name: UI Trace View
sub_features.notes: Shows retrieval steps and relevance via integrated frameworks, but lacks a dedicated UI specifically for chunk content or retrieval scores.

sub_features.name: Tool/Function call parsing
sub_features.notes: Renders parsed inputs and returned values directly within the trace spans for agent tools.

sub_features.name: Agents Service Map
sub_features.notes: DAG/graph visualization displaying execution flow, loops, branches, and component interactions.

sub_features.name: Step-by-step debugging
sub_features.notes: Stores and displays agent intermediate reasoning and Chain-of-Thought states within general traces.

sub_features.name: Trace replay view
sub_features.notes: Supports session-based UI inspection of conversational flows, but lacks an interactive step-through replay mode.

sub_features.name: Error details view
sub_features.notes: Automatically highlights failed operational steps in traces including error details and latency metrics.

sub_features.name: MCP Server integration
sub_features.notes: Offers direct observability connection allowing tracing for platforms like GitHub Copilot, Claude, and Cursor.

sub_features.name: LLM as a Judge Builder
sub_features.notes: GUI-based, no-code required evaluation setup builder that scales properly to production.

sub_features.name: Code-based metrics
sub_features.notes: Ability to write user-defined code-based evaluation functions and have them run via the execution engine.

sub_features.name: Dataset management
sub_features.notes: Enables dataset creation, versioning, trace-to-dataset conversion, and implements clustering algorithms for curation.

sub_features.name: Dataset Evaluators
sub_features.notes: Allows attaching evaluator suites directly to datasets to turn them into reusable evaluation suites that automatically run server-side upon experiment execution.

sub_features.name: Prompt playground / DSPy Integrations
sub_features.notes: Integrates optimization features via DSPy for candidate suggestion and systematic prompt optimization.

sub_features.name: Regression detection
sub_features.notes: Eval-driven continuous checks detecting quality regressions on model and prompt changes.

sub_features.name: Experiments UI
sub_features.notes: Enables comparing variations within the experiments tab, but there is no specific explicit 'side-by-side' specialized UI.

sub_features.name: Human annotation workflows
sub_features.notes: Capabilities tailored for teams performing manual evaluations, with specific assignment functionality and queue management.

sub_features.name: Real-time evaluation
sub_features.notes: Enables proactive automatic evaluation capabilities on live production traffic mapped back through generated traces.

sub_features.name: Hallucination-detecting tool
sub_features.notes: Provides a dedicated LLM-powered evaluation metric guardrail designed to identify hallucinated content.

sub_features.name: Evaluation Framework
sub_features.notes: Topics can be monitored using custom LLM-as-a-Judge evals, but lacks dedicated out-of-the-box jailbreak detection implementations.

sub_features.name: Arize AX Cost Analytics
sub_features.notes: Provided in commercial tiers (Arize AX) allowing project/user attribution, but missing or very limited in the core open-source Phoenix tool.

sub_features.name: Token usage breakdowns
sub_features.notes: Displays precise token consumption with input/output analytics mapping into observable trends.

sub_features.name: Latency distribution monitoring
sub_features.notes: Presents runtime latency distributions with proper heatmaps allowing detailed viewing down to the P99 level.

sub_features.name: Error rate tracking
sub_features.notes: Maintains persistent tracking over operational error rates alongside active alerting functionalities.

sub_features.name: Embedding clustering
sub_features.notes: Calculates and maps t-SNE / UMAP plots allowing visual tracking regarding concepts and embedding drift detection.

sub_features.name: Custom metric dashboards
sub_features.notes: Exposes widgets permitting user-defined metrics to be freely pinned to dashboards.

sub_features.name: Prompt Serving/Management
sub_features.notes: Versioned interface accommodating non-developers to edit visually, maintain versions, and deploy live prompts.

sub_features.name: Prompt playground
sub_features.notes: Dedicated interactive sandbox section created to manually configure and test targeted prompts or parameters.

sub_features.name: Custom Providers Configuration
sub_features.notes: Centralized credential storage and routing configuration for custom providers (including OpenAI Responses API type vs Chat Completions) reusable across playground and prompt versions.

sub_features.name: Experiments feature
sub_features.notes: Allows tracking of variations testing (A/B testing) along with automated hyperparameter capturing via logging.

sub_features.name: Dataset export formats
sub_features.notes: Provides export outputs geared toward fine-tuning model efforts internally, though lacking fully connected direct pipeline interfaces.

sub_features.name: Prompt versioning
sub_features.notes: Model controls capturing current schemas, retaining versions, and providing complete immediate rollback execution capability.

sub_features.name: OpenInference SDK
sub_features.notes: Official native SDK provides comprehensive coverage primarily in Python, while JS and Go rely on standard general OTLP paths.

sub_features.name: Built-in support
sub_features.notes: Excellent dedicated support implementations accommodating DSPy, Haystack, AutoGen/smolagents, LangChain, LlamaIndex.

sub_features.name: REST API connectivity
sub_features.notes: Traces and specific queries can be interacted with directly using the REST structure with webhooks implied by monitors usage.

sub_features.name: CI/CD Experiments
sub_features.notes: Ties into automated pipelines relying heavily on GitHub Actions deployments initiating evals effectively.

sub_features.name: OSS & Arize AX Tiers
sub_features.notes: Includes multi-tenant managed SaaS, Self-hosted open source formats, alongside managed isolated VPC alternatives.

sub_features.name: Arize Phoenix OSS
sub_features.notes: Open-core ELv2 licensed tool allowing unrestricted platform usage holding an inclusive and highly active GitHub base.

sub_features.name: AX Enterprise Compliance
sub_features.notes: AX achieves compliance structures like SOC2 alongside explicit GDPR controls and regions. OSS instances remain entirely privately governed (Self-managed). Explicit HIPAA references notably omitted.

sub_features.name: Enterprise RBAC
sub_features.notes: Arize AX exclusively holds integrations for handling deep access restrictions, managing role schemas alongside functional SAML / Identity SSO setups.

sub_features.name: AX Audit Systems
sub_features.notes: Available system trace logs derived out of retentions normally, yet pure identity auditing actions generally require full AX.

sub_features.name: Export functions
sub_features.notes: Exporters structured out-the-box natively accommodating continuous transfers mapping directly to options like S3 pipelines, Snowflake, and BigQuery.
